description.S1: Abernathy asked you to bring him a cache of anthrocillin hidden in the Emerald Vale Community Center.

blurb.B1: This quest is started by speaking with Martin Abernathy and agreeing to freelance for him.
blurb.B2: He will ask the Stranger to retrieve a crate of Experimental Anthrocillin which is located in the Emerald Vale Community Center.
blurb.B3: He will also mention the dangers associated with the group of marauders that have recently taken over the center and its surrounding area.
blurb.B5: the Stranger is approached by Esther Blaine who makes a counteroffer.
blurb.B6: Abernathy is a hypochondriac, she claims,
blurb.B7: and she would put the medicine to better use.
blurb.B8: She offers to match the amount which Abernathy is offering.

description.S2: He wants a special cache of anthrocillin,
description.S3: found in the Emerald Vale Community Center.
description.S4: Esther confronted you outside of Abernathy's house,
description.S5: and suggested that you should give the medicine to her instead of Abernathy.

blurb.B1: You can find the Experimental Anthrocillin in the Emerald Vale Community Center inside the medical area.
blurb.B2: You'll need the Medical Bay key to get in there,
blurb.B3: which can be found on one of the Marauders.
blurb.B4: Once you obtain it you can give it to Esther or Martin.

dialog.speaker: EstherBlaine (Female)
dialog.utterance: Excuse me. I'm Esther Blaine - Spacer's Choice actuary. I overheard your talk with Abernathy. I hope you're not thinking about getting him that medicine.

dialog.speaker: EstherBlaine (Female)
dialog.utterance: Abernathy is a well-known hypochondriac. Anthrocillin is wasted on him. You're better off selling it to me instead.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What do you need it for?

dialog.speaker: EstherBlaine (Female)
dialog.utterance: I probably shouldn't tell you. Don't want you implicated for what I'm trying to do.

dialog.speaker: EstherBlaine (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm doing right by the town. I'll tell you that much. You bring me that medicine, and I'll see that it goes to the right people.

dialog.speaker: EstherBlaine (Female)
dialog.utterance: That's all I can ask of you.
